channel.title: Help!@ Can't connect through no-ip but can through localhost!
channel.description:
I'm having trouble trying to connect through my no-ip but i can connect fine if i type in localhost. i have no-ip downloaded and running. I have a router with the ports forwarded. I really neeeeed help. :confused:
I've looked through the "How to make a server" about 13 times and no help.... :(

item.title: Help!@ Can't connect through no-ip but can through localhost!
item.dc:creator: @laxmaster213 laxmaster213
item.description:
@laxmaster213 wrote:

well YOu should login as server ip “localhost” or “127.0.0.1”

then other people will connect using the no-ip address but they wont beable to if you havent port fowarded you port on your modem or router

Read full topic
item.source: Help!@ Can't connect through no-ip but can through localhost!

item.title: Help!@ Can't connect through no-ip but can through localhost!
item.dc:creator: @rparkie rparkie
item.description:
@rparkie wrote:

yeah thats my problem other people cant get into my server even though i run the server and it says online, people cant get in.

This is really frustrating.

i dont know how to get people to log into my server or how to make my server online for others…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 12, 2008, 07:49:53 pm[/size][hr]Do you have to edit things in your source to get your no-ip address to connect to your server?

Read full topic

item.title: Help!@ Can't connect through no-ip but can through localhost!
item.dc:creator: @laxmaster213 laxmaster213

well if YOU are trying to connect with no-ip then yes u wont get into ur server but if other people arent getting in then u have a problem

item.title: Help!@ Can't connect through no-ip but can through localhost!
item.dc:creator: @rparkie rparkie
item.description:
@rparkie wrote:

I’m pretty sure i portforwarded already and I think that i did it right

EX:
43594------>43594 BOTH:UDP and TCP IP: Enabled

I know this may sound stupid but what goes in the IP? lol

I’m asking this because there are different types of IP’s( router ip, internet ip, etc.

My default for my linksys router is 192.168.1.xxx-------which goes in fortforwarding example above
I have to replace the x’s

Read full topic

did you even portforward yet?

item.source: Help!@ Can't connect through no-ip but can through localhost!

item.title: Help!@ Can't connect through no-ip but can through localhost!
item.dc:creator: @Oo_Java Oo Java
item.description:
@Oo_Java wrote:

Connect through no-ip address.

127.0.0.1 is your localhost so it will load regardless of whether it’s online or not.

I’m not sure for a linksys router, you may have to check on google. But go to this IP Address “192.168.0.1” on your browser.

Username: admin
Password: pass/password/admin

Username will be admin, I’m not sure on your password. And go to the “Gaming/Application” tab on your router configuration and make exceptions for everything and unblock all ports.

Read full topic
item.source: Help!@ Can't connect through no-ip but can through localhost!

item.title: Help!@ Can't connect through no-ip but can through localhost!
item.dc:creator: @rparkie rparkie
item.description:
@rparkie wrote:

I have 43594 TCP port open on my firewall exceptions.

I dont think the router is blocking 43594 ports. I have a linksys router. Where would i go to check if it is blocking any ports?

Also how do I know that my server is online? Do i have to sign in under my no-ip address or 127.0.0.1 or my ip address?

Read full topic
item.source: Help!@ Can't connect through no-ip but can through localhost!

item.title: Help!@ Can't connect through no-ip but can through localhost!
item.dc:creator: @Oo_Java Oo Java
item.description:
@Oo_Java wrote:

What are your firewall settings configured to?

They made need to be modified to no firewall, also check your router settings to check it’s not blocking any ports.

Read full topic
